intro: Cyrtopera chlorotica, commonly known as the greenleaf spurge. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a structure called a cyathium. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Cyrtopera chlorotica is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments.
